result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Z. Peck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**2 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: No threats or acts of violence towards anyone.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Z. Peck

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA and probation forms.

(10:04 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph Z. Peck in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joseph Z. Peck.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3: Domestic Misdemeanor Battery and Count 4: Domestic Disorderly Conduct.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of Count 3 and Count 4.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
30 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on Count 3. No threats or acts of violence towards anyone. Complete a Domestic Abuse assessment and follow through with any recommendations. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 2 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

(9:52 AM case called.) Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph Z. Peck in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joseph Z. Peck. 
Attorney Rivard advises there is an offer and defendant will be accepting it, but needs time to finalize aspects of the agreement.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Rivard to schedule an Arraignment (possible plea hearing) with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.

Conditions: 
Contact with M.P. allowed only through a third party, or by telephonic means.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered 03/24/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 04/04/2022.
To remove the condition of no contact with M.P. or M.P.'s residence, and add the condition of allow contact through a third party and by telephonic means only.

Court order to amend bond and conditions of bond to remove the condition of no contact with M.P. or M.P.'s residence, and add the condition of allow contact through a third party and by telephonic means only. All other conditions of bond shall remain in effect until further order of the Court.

Attorney Francis Rivard at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 04/22/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
